articles.title: Kim Jong Un Meets Syrian Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Meets Syrian Delegation
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, met the delegation of the Syrian Arab Republic led by Abdullah al-Ahmar, deputy general secretary of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party, on Wednesday.
					 The delegation is visiting the DPRK to participate in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Present there were members of the delegation and Haissam Saad, charge d' affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam and Kim Yang Gon, secretaries of the Central Committee of the WPK, and Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, were present there.
					
					 Kim Jong Un cordially met with the Syrian guests and had a talk with them.
					
					 The deputy general secretary conveyed the warm greetings of Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad to Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 He offered warmest congratulations to Marshal Kim Jong Un and the friendly Korean people on behalf of President Bashar Al-Assad and the Syrian people on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and expressed best wishes for Kim Jong Un's good health and happiness and for the Korean people's success in the efforts to build a thriving nation.
					
					 He expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation that exist between the Syrian Arab Republic and the DPRK would continue growing strong in the interests of the two peoples.
					
					 Kim Jong Un warmly welcomed the delegation of the Syrian Arab Republic which made a long trip to come to the DPRK for taking part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and extended a militant salute to President Bashar Al-Assad and the Syrian people.
					
					 Saying he was pleased to meet with the deputy general secretary who was received by President Kim Il Sung several times, Kim Jong Un noted it is a great encouragement to the Korean people that the party and government of Syria dispatched the delegation to the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the war.
					
					 He exchanged with the guests views on the issue of boosting the bilateral relations and other issues of mutual concern including the regional situation.
					
					 The conversation proceeded in a friendly and amicable atmosphere.
					
					 Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift of best wishes by the deputy general secretary.
					
					 He expressed deep thanks for this.

Senior Party, State Officials Visit Lodging Quarters of War Veteran Delegates
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials Wednesday visited lodging quarters of the war veteran delegates who are to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: War Veterans Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
War Veterans Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- War veteran delegates visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Wednesday to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. They are to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They entered the hall where the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il stand. 
					
					 They paid homage to the Generalissimos before the statues.
					
					 In the halls where the Generalissimos lie in state, the delegates paid tribute to them, making a silent report that the immortal feats of the Generalissimos are being carried forward under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un who is glorifying the history and tradition of the victory that was started on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The delegates looked round the halls where the orders the Generalissimos received are on display and halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches they used during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moment of their lives.

					 Recollecting with deep emotion the noble revolutionary career of the peerlessly great men who provided the eternal foundation for the prosperity of the country, the delegates placed the floral baskets and bouquets before the statues and paid tribute.

articles.title: Anti-Japanese Fighters, War Veterans and Persons of Merit during Wartime Honored
articles.content:
Anti-Japanese Fighters, War Veterans and Persons of Merit during Wartime Honored
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- 47 075 people were awarded Order Commemorating the 60th Anniversary of the Victory in the Fatherland Liberation War in the DPRK. They are anti-Japanese fighters, war veterans and persons of merit who performed undying feats during the war and made big contributions to building a thriving nation after the war. 
					 A decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly was adopted on July 10.
					
					 The brave soldiers of the Korean People's Army and people made great contributions to winning a shining victory in the war by fully displaying matchless popular heroism and patriotism on the front and in the rear with the firm belief that the DPRK would surely win as it was led by President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 In the post-war period, too, the war veterans and merited persons have rendered great services for defending the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation and hastening socialist construction, foiling all the moves of the U.S. imperialists to ignite a war under the Songun leadership of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The decree says that the war veterans and merited persons who fought at the risk of their lives for the country and posterity are precious treasure of the country and benefactors and there is prosperity thanks to them.

articles.title: KPA Service Personnel Meet
articles.content:
KPA Service Personnel Meet
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- A meeting of officers and men of the Korean People's Army (KPA) took place before the statues of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il at the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. They vowed to eternally glorify the undying feats the Generalissimos performed by leading confrontation with imperialism and the U.S. to a victory and reunify the country without fail under the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, Kim Kyok Sik, chief of the KPA General Staff, Jang Jong Nam, minister of the People's Armed Forces, officials of the ministry, officers and men of the Ground Force, Navy and Air and Anti-Air Force of the KPA, cadets of military academies and students of revolutionary schools.
					
					 In his report Choe Ryong Hae said the brilliant victory in the Fatherland Liberation War was a victory of the outstanding military idea of Kim Il Sung and his original strategies, tactics and war methods and a victory of the indomitable mental power displayed by the army and people of the DPRK rallied close around him.
					
					 The feats Kim Il Sung performed by winning a victory in the war could shed their bright rays century after century thanks to Kim Jong Il, a peerlessly brilliant Songun commander, the reporter noted, and went on:
					
					 The history and tradition of victory provided by the Generalissimos are being firmly defended thanks to the outstanding and tested leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, another greatest-ever commander.
					
					 The reporter called for defending the undying feats the Generalissimos performed in the war and Songun revolution and glorifying July 27, the day of war victory, as the day of a victory in national reunification under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 No Kwang Chol, deputy chief of the KPA General Staff, Kim Myong Sik, commander of the Navy, and Ri Pyong Chol, commander of the Air and Anti-Air Force, in their speeches vowed to inherit the spirit of matchless offensive displayed by the heroic soldiers in the 1950s to successfully conclude the fight for national reunification, and thus display fireworks of victory in the sky above the powerful Paektusan nation.

articles.title: Women's Union Marks War Victory Anniversary
articles.content:
Women's Union Marks War Victory Anniversary
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- An oratorical meeting of the women's union and a performance of the art squad of the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) took place at the Hall of Women on Wednesday to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present there were Ri Yong Su, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ro Song Sil, chairwoman of the C.C., the DWUK, officials concerned and women's union officials and members in Pyongyang.
					
					 Oratories included "Long live the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War", "Eternal July 27 of victory" and "Spring thunder".
					
					 The performers said that the women across the country are full of boundless reverence for the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu, who wisely guided the confrontation with the U.S.
					
					 They stressed that the historic appeal made by Marshal Kim Jong Un for opening a new heyday on all fronts of socialist construction by creating the "speed on Masik Pass" serves as the thunder of Songun Korea.
					
					 The oratories gave deep impressions to the participants as they called for powerfully demonstrating the wisdom and stamina of the Korean women in the effort for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 A performance was given by the art squad of the union.
					
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers including poem and chorus "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung", "July 27, Our Victory Day", instrumental music and songs "Song of National Defence" and "Advance", poem and solo "Red Chol Pass" and trio "When Singing of Songun".

articles.title: Art Performance Marks War Victory Day
articles.content:
Art Performance Marks War Victory Day
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- An art performance "July 27, the V-Day, will be forever" was given by workers and union members at the Central Hall of Workers on Wednesday in celebration of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Among the audience were Ri Yong Su, department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, and union officials and members, war veterans and workers.
					
					 It started with narration and chorus "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" and chorus "Our Victory-Day July 27".
					
					 Put on the stage were numbers praising the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung, who wisely led the army and people to win the war, protecting the freedom and sovereignty of the country and the happiness of the people.
					
					 Male solo "We Will Never Forget", male chorus "Red Chol Pass" and other numbers praised the feats Generalissimo Kim Jong Il performed by holding high the banner of Songun and winning one victory after another in the anti-imperialist and anti-U.S. struggle.
					
					 Mixed chorus "At a Go", light music for accordion solo "Are We Living Like in Those Days?" and other numbers well showed the revolutionary will of the workers and union members to remain loyal to the Songun leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un like the preceding generations who were loyal to the party and the leader.

articles.title: Performance Given by Art Groups in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Performance Given by Art Groups in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- A performance "Song of war victory reverberating far above the sky above Pyongyang" was given by art groups here at the Central Youth Hall Wednesday to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The performance started with chorus "July 27 March". Put on the stage were colorful numbers given by members of art groups of institutions, industrial establishments and universities in the city including Pyongyang Kim Jong Suk Silk Mill, Pyongyang Department Store No. 1, Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Kim Hyong Jik University of Education and Kim Chol Ju University of Education, members of art groups of war veterans and the city art squad.
					
					 In such numbers like poem and story "Banner of Victory", male solo and small chorus "Marshal Kim Il Sung Is Our Supreme Commander", the performers praised the feats of war victory by the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, who defeated the U.S. imperialist allied forces and set a shining example in the revolutionary war against imperialism.
					
					 War veterans put on the stage male chorus "Song of National Defence", mixed chorus "The Dear Home in My Native Village". Appreciating the songs, the audience extended hearty salute to the victors of the great annals.
					
					 Also put on the stage were narration and Oungum ensemble "When We Sing of Songun", trio poem "Endless Songun Journey of the General", agitation and song "Peace is Guaranteed by Our Arms", drum and song "At a Go" and dance "Triplets Leaving for Post".
					
					  The performance represented the revolutionary will of all service personnel and people to carry forward the July 27 of war victory into a grand war for the country's reunification.
					
					 Appreciating the performance were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, and others, war veterans, officials and other people, youth and students of the city.

articles.title: Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition Opens 
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia exhibition opened here with due ceremony at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition on Wednesday to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The venue of the exhibition was decorated with flowers praising the sun and various kinds of other rare flowers. Displayed in the venue were pictures of smiling Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 On display at the exhibition were more than 20 000 potted Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia flowers cultivated with all sincerity by many units including armed forces organs, ministries and national institutions, the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), overseas Koreans, missions of different countries and international bodies here, friendly and solidarity organizations and individuals of different countries.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, officials concerned, officials of the units who presented flowers, service personnel and participants in the exhibition.
					
					 Also present there were a congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan led by Hong In Hum, chairman of the Central Audit Committee of Chongryon, a delegation of the General Association of Koreans in China led by Chairwoman Choe Un Bok and other overseas Koreans' delegations, overseas Koreans and foreigners. They came here to participate in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the war.
					
					 Kim Chang Do, chairman of the Korean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee, in an opening address said that the exhibition is a flower garden which reflects the boundless reverence of the service personnel and people of the DPRK and the progressive mankind for Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He said that Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia, famous flowers named after the great Generalissimos, are national treasures of Songun Korea that give a great pride and honor to the service personnel and people of the DPRK.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, the participants looked round the flowers on display.

articles.title: New Postage Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Postage Stamps Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has recently issued new postage stamps (two sheets, a sheetlet and an individual stamp) on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953).
					 Seen in the upper part of each stamp are letters "In celebration of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War" and "Juche 42 (1953)-Juche 102 (2013)".
					
					 The sheets feature a picture of President Kim Il Sung delivering a radio address titled "Go All Out for Victory in the War" on June 26, 1950 and a picture of him making a speech at the Pyongyang city mass rally held in celebration of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War on July 28, 1953.
					
					 Also printed in them are a picture of servicepersons advancing southward during the war and a picture of those in the military parade celebrating the war victory.
					
					 The sheetlet carries a picture of Kim Il Sung planning a new round of counter-offensive for reversing the war situation during his stay in Kosanjin, Manpho City, Jagang Province and a picture of him meeting with meritorious soldiers, including heroes of the republic. 
					
					 It pictures cars the President used in wartime, score of wartime song "To a Decisive Battle" and Korean People's Army soldiers in fighting battles.
					
					 The individual stamp has a picture of the main sculpture "Victory" of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower, with letters "July 27, Victory Day".

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Performed for Victory in War Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Performed for Victory in War Lauded
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- A public presentation of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces on the greatness and exploits President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed by winning a victory in the anti-imperialist struggle took place on Wednesday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army (KPA), Kim Kyok Sik, chief of the General Staff of the KPA, Jang Jong Nam, minister of the People's Armed Forces, officials of the ministry and service persons.
					
					 The speakers referred to the immortal exploits performed by Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle and the wise leadership of Supreme Commander Marshal Kim Jong Un, another illustrious commander.
					
					 They went on:
					
					 The victory won by Kim Il Sung in the Fatherland Liberation War is the military miracle in which he defeated the strongest and most ferocious imperialist allied forces for the first time in history and a miracle of history wrought by the Korean people with their own efforts with the People's Army as the core.
					
					 Kim Jong Il consolidated as firm as an iron wall the military position of socialism with the People's Army as the core, under the uplifted banner of Songun, providing a powerful military guarantee for a victory in the showdown with imperialism and the U.S.
					
					 Kim Jong Un is wisely leading the present fierce confrontation with the U.S., taking the immortal exploits performed by the great Generalissimos in winning the victory in the war and leading the  Songun revolution as treasured swords for sure victory.
					
					 They stressed that the exploits performed by the Generalissimos would be immortal and the day of final victory is sure to come as the army and people are led by Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Meeting for Solidarity with Korean People Held
articles.content:
Meeting for Solidarity with Korean People Held
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The participants in the grand international peace march demanding the conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. and the withdrawal of the hostile policy towards the DPRK and supporting the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea held a meeting for solidarity with the Korean people in Kaesong City on Wednesday.
					 Prior to the meeting, the participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Janam Hill in Kaesong and paid tribute.
					
					 It was attended by delegations and delegates of friendship and solidarity organizations from different countries and international bodies and other foreign guests, the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front and overseas Koreans.
					
					 Choe Jin Su, presidium member of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with the World People who doubles as vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and people in the city.
					
					 The floor was taken by Harun-Ar-Rashid, chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, Viktor Yegorov, chairman of the Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia, Dermot Hudson, vice-chairman of the British Friendship Society with Korea, and Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea.
					
					 They said that visiting Panmunjom they deeply felt sufferings the Korean people are undergoing due to the national division and clearly realized the reason why Korea still remains divided.
					
					 They noted that a nuclear war is averted on the Korean Peninsula and peace is preserved entirely thanks to the consistent efforts of the DPRK.
					
					 Pak Yong Phal, chairman of the Kaesong City People's Committee, said in his speech that the Korean people will firmly defend the sovereignty of the country, step up the building of a thriving nation and reunify the country without fail, true to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.             
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un from the participants of the grand international peace march was adopted and a declaration in the name of the participants was read out at the meeting.

articles.title: Songs Inspire Pride in War Victory
articles.content:
Songs Inspire Pride in War Victory
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- New songs have come out in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea with the approach of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953), adding to the festive mood. 
					 The songs include "July 27 March", "Tell, Fireworks of War Victory", "Respects to Victors of Great Age" and "Holiday of Great War Victory".
					
					 They remind people of the military parade held in celebration of the war victory and the history of the victory the DPRK won in the showdown with the U.S.-led imperialists under the guidance of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 "July 27 March" sings of the Korean people's pride in bringing to knees the U.S. in the war for the first time in history.
					
					 "Respects to Victors of Great Age" is full of high respects for fallen fighters and war veterans.
					
					 "Tell, Fireworks of War Victory" makes people recall the feats the soldiers of the Korean People's Army performed in the war.
					
					 "Holiday of Great War Victory" portrays the pledge of younger generations to carry forward the spirit of defending the motherland the servicepersons kept in wartime.
					
					 Some days ago, the songs were awarded a decoration instituted in honor of the 60th anniversary of the war victory.

articles.title: Panmunjom Draws Many Foreigners, Overseas Koreans
articles.content:
Panmunjom Draws Many Foreigners, Overseas Koreans 
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Many foreigners and overseas Koreans are now visiting Panmunjom, where the army and people of the DPRK forced the U.S. imperialist aggressors to sign the document of surrender on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War (Korean War).
					 More than 599 000 people of at least 39 700 foreign organizations and overseas Koreans organizations have visited Panmunjom since the ceasefire. 
					
					 There are the monument to the document on national reunification autographed by President Kim Il Sung, the room where armistice talks were held, the hall where the armistice agreement was signed, Panmun Pavilion, Thongil House and others at Panmunjom. 
					
					 Visitors are deeply impressed to hear the story that the army and people of the DPRK humbled the arrogance of the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being "the strongest" in the world and won a victory in the Korean War on July 27, 1953. 
					
					 Military Attache of the Iranian Embassy here Hassan Reza Husseini wrote in the visitor's book that under the leadership of Kim Il Sung the Korean people achieved a shining victory in the Korean War.
					
					 This serves as an example for the world progressives who are waging a dynamic struggle for independence against imperialism, he added. 
					
					 Korean in Brazil Kim Hak Gu said that the U.S. imperialists have gone downhill since they were defeated in the Korean war, adding that they should not forget the historical bitter lesson. 
					
					 The representative of the Yemeni Council for Peace and Unity said that the danger of war can never be defused on the Korean Peninsula as long as the U.S. imperialists remain in south Korea.  In order to ensure peace in Korea, it is necessary for the U.S. imperialists immediately withdraw from south Korea, taking with them their nuclear weapons, the representative stressed.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Leadership for Victory in War
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Leadership for Victory in War
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung visited 1 000 plus units, covering more than 20 480 km during the hard-fought war. He, sharing his destiny with the service personnel and people, led the Fatherland Liberation War to victory with his distinguished military wisdom, outstanding strategy and tactics, big trust and loving care.
					 The three-year war started by the U.S. imperialists was a fierce political and military stand-off between the only two year old DPRK and the U.S. which boasted of numerical and technological advantages with a hundred and scores of years of history of aggression, troops of 15 satellite countries as well as puppet south Korean army and the Japanese militarists.
					
					 On June 25, 1950, the U.S. imperialist aggressors invaded the DPRK all of sudden.
					
					 The President immediately set forth the strategic policy in the first phase of the war on June 25 to resolutely thwart the enemies' invasion and promptly launch a counterattack. The next day, he in his historic radio speech appealed to the party, army and people to turn out in the sacred battle to wipe out the U.S. and its stooges from the territory of Korea.
					
					 He made field inspection of Seoul several times from July 15 to August 14, Juche 39 (1950), a historic course which provided a turn in the first phase of the war.
					
					 He crossed the iron bridge over the River Rimjin in mid-July by jeep and reached the front command in Seoul where he straightaway unfolded the strategic plan of conducting the operation of encircling Taejon.
					
					 At the end of July he again left for his journey to the front.
					
					 He went to Suanbo very close to the foremost front and advanced an operational policy of rapidly crossing the River Rakdong and destroying enemies in the Masan, Taegu, Yongchon and Phohang perimeters. On August 9 he went to Seoul and clarified the shortcut to victory to completely liberate the southern part of Korea.
					
					 The 2 240 km-long journey to the front made by the President resulted in liberating over 90 percent of the south Korean area and over 92 percent of the south Korean population in little more than a month since the war started.
					
					 The situation on the front made a U-turn around September 1950.
					
					 Enemies backed by huge reinforcements desperately attempted a "general offensive" in the River Rakdong perimeter and launched a massive landing operation in Inchon area.
					
					 With scientific insight into the change of the relations of forces between friends and foes and the situation on the front, the President advanced a strategic policy in the second phase of the war in mid-September on forming a strong counterattack group while ensuring the temporary strategic retreat of the main forces of the People's Army by delaying the enemies' advance as much as possible.
					
					 To tide over the grave difficulties, the President set up the commanding post of the Supreme Command in Okchon-myon (at that time) in Maengsan County from October 16 to 20 and set forth the operational plan of forming the second front of the combined units of the People's Army while commanding the retreat to a success.
					
					 Based on the analysis of the preparations of the People's Army for counterattack, weak points of the enemies and relations of forces between friends and foes, the President advanced the strategic policy in the third phase of the war and visited over 310 units, covering 5 120 km for its realization.
					
					 Staying in Kosanjin (at that time) from November 4 to December 18, the President led the new counterattack operation to victory, opening up an epochal turn in the war.
					
					 He ordered the army to launch a decisive counterattack on all fronts toward the end of November 1950.
					
					 After leaving Kosanjin, he made 280 km journey at night to reach at Taeyu-dong, Tongchang County on November 28 where he organized and commanded the operations for encircling and annihilating the main group of enemies in the River Chongchon, Lake Jangjin and Chongjin and Hamhung areas.
					
					 The units on the second front together with the combined forces of the People's Army launched a fierce attack, shattering the enemies' "Christmas offensive" and liberating all areas in the northern half of Korea.
					
					 After convening the 30th plenary meeting of the Cabinet in Yonphung-dong, Kanggye City in mid-December, the President continued his journey to Hyangha, Janggang County.
					
					 At the third plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea from December 21 to 23 he made a historic report "The Present Situation and the Immediate Tasks" and the conclusion, indicating important tasks for consolidating the victory won in the counterattack, strengthening the party and enhancing its role.
					
					 He moved the Supreme Command to Konji-ri (at that time) in January, Juche 40 (1951) and guided more than 200 important meetings of the party, army and state till the war ended. He continued his guidance from the Supreme Command to the front and again from the front to the rear, leading the army and people to victory.
					
					 In mid-1951, the President set forth the strategic policy in the fourth phase of the war on holding initiative of the war and achieving the final victory.
					
					 He visited more than 600 battle sites on the front and rear including Mt. Jihye, Sungap-ri and Puldanggol as well as factories and farms, covering over 12 640 km, a significant journey that led to the final victory in the war.
					
					 It was thanks to the wise guidance of Kim Il Sung that the enemies' "autumn offensive" was totally thwarted in early November 1951.
					
					 In June 1952 when the U.S. imperialists tried to massively build up forces behind the scene of the armistice talks and clinch "honorable talks" the President again made his field guidance to North Phyongan Province to increase the combat capabilities of the People's Army and strengthen the rear.
					
					 He inspected the front command in Sungap-ri, Kumgang County and the combined unit in Soksa-ri in fall of 1952, clarifying the operational policy for foiling the enemies' "Kimhwa offensive" by the Korean war method.
					
					 In February 1953, the President crossed snowy mountains and ridges including Masik Pass in the eastern area and Myongmun Pass in the northern area, arousing soldiers of units on the foremost front, working people in Jagang and South Phyongan provinces to the final victory in the war.
					
					 Early in May he went to the conference hall of the armistice talks and clarified the bright idea and ways for wringing the windpipe of the enemies and securing surrender from them and led the operation for the third strong counterattack to bring about a decisive victory. 
					
					 On July 27, Juche 42 (1953) time has come for the U.S. which boasted of being the "strongest" in the world to kneel before the Koreans and sign the document of surrender.
					
					 The President at a historic place which is now the Jonsung Revolutionary Site finally examined the document of the Armistice Agreement and ratified it.
					
					 The brilliant victory won in the hard-fought war was a victory of the President's outstanding idea, strategy and tactics and warm loving care for the people.

articles.title: Kimilsungia Exhibition Held in Guinea
articles.content:
Kimilsungia Exhibition Held in Guinea
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- A Kimilsungia exhibition was held in Conakry on July 15 under the sponsorship of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association in Guinea to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 On display in the exhibition were photos documenting the undying feats of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Also displayed there were pictures showing the Korean people's struggle for building a thriving nation and Kimilsungia in full bloom.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony of the exhibition were figures of various social strata in Guinea. Members of the DPRK embassy in Conakry attended the ceremony on invitation.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association in Guinea who is chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that President Kim Il Sung led the anti-Japanese war to a brilliant victory and realized the country's liberation. He went on:
					
					 The President defeated the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being "the strongest" in the world in the 1950-1953 Korean war to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country.
					
					 The Korean people's miraculous victory in the war was a result of the President's wise leadership.
					
					 The President led the severe confrontation with U.S. imperialism to victory after the war and thus converted the DPRK into an invincible socialist power.
					
					 His immortal military exploits will shine forever with the world history of struggle against imperialism.
					
					 Banou Keita, chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, said as follows:
					
					 The young DPRK, less than two years old, wrought the miracle in the severe confrontation with the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces. It was the victory of the outstanding strategy and tactics and superb military methods of the President.
					
					 The President who decorated the pages of the modern history of wars with the unique tactics was a peerless strategist and invincible and iron-willed commander.
					
					 He is, indeed, a peerlessly great man and a great sage who is always alive in the hearts of mankind

articles.title: Events in Various Countries Celebrate Korean People's Victory in War
articles.content:
Events in Various Countries Celebrate Korean People's Victory in War
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries on July 17 to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 A seminar was held in the building of the Romanian Socialist Union, a film show in the building of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle and a book and photo exhibition at a hotel of Malaysia.
					
					 Present there were figures of various social strata and other people in the above-said countries.
					
					 The chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union said that the Korean people's victory in the Korean war was a precious fruition of the talented wisdom and superb military tactics of President Kim Il Sung, an outstanding strategist. He went on:
					
					 The Korean people's victory was a historical event that brought about the beginning of a downhill turn for U.S. imperialism which boasted of being "the strongest" in the world and instilled into the progressive humankind the belief that U.S. imperialism is not formidable enemy and if one fights against it, one can certainly win.
					
					 In those days the high-ranking politicians and famous generals of the U.S. confessed that the myth of the U.S. "mightiness" was completely shattered in the Korean war.
					
					 The war fully showed the wisdom of the President's leadership and the heroic spirit of the Korean people firmly united around him.
					
					 The section chief for international relations of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle said that he could not repress his admiration after watching a film showing the invincible might of the Korean People's Army. He went on:
					
					 If the U.S. continues trying to bring the DPRK into submission by force, it will meet a defeat as in the Korean war 60 years ago.
					
					 The Korean people will certainly build a thriving nation and achieve the cause of the country's reunification as they are led by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The director of a Malaysian company praised the President as a great brilliant commander who led the Fatherland Liberation War against the U.S. invasion to victory.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Kyrgyzstan, Myanmar and Benin on July 16 and 17 to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present at the meetings were personages of various circles and masses in those countries.
					
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity "Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party who is also chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, said the Korean people defeated U.S. imperialism which boasted of being the "strongest" in the world under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung. He lauded the President for hewing out the Korean revolution and leading it to  victory with arms.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung was, indeed, a legendary hero, military prodigy and iron-willed commander who performed great military exploits to be recorded in human history with his outstanding military idea and original strategy and tactics through the protracted hard struggle for defending the sovereignty of the country.
					
					 Now the DPRK led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un is demonstrating its might as a nuclear weapons state which is also capable of manufacturing and launching satellites.
					
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" who doubles as chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said Kim Il Sung put forth original war methods and left a brilliant page in the world modern war history.
					
					 Kim Il Sung was, indeed, a gifted strategist and great commander, he added.
					
					 Pascal Zouncheme, rector of the Cotonou Institute of Journalism of Benin who is also chairman of the Beninese Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said the service personnel and people of the DPRK led by Marshal Kim Jong Un will create the ever-victorious history, true to the intentions of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Bangladeshi, Philippine Ambassadors
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Bangladeshi, Philippine Ambassadors
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, respectively received credentials from new Bangladeshi Ambassador to the DPRK Muhammad Azizul Haque and new Philippine Ambassador to the DPRK  Erlinda F. DPRK FM Meets New Bangladeshi Ambassador 
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Wednesday met and had a talk with new Bangladeshi Ambassador to the DPRK Muhammad Azizul Haque who paid a courtesy call on him.

KCNA Delegation Back Home 
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean Central News Agency led by Vice Director General Ri Kwan Sam Wednesday came back home by air after visiting Russia.

articles.title: Grand International Peace March Staged
articles.content:
Grand International Peace March Staged
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- A grand international peace march took place from Pyongyang to Kaesong on Wednesday to demand the conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. and the withdrawal of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and support the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea.
					 A kick-off ceremony was held prior to the march.
					
					 Present there were foreign guests, the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front and overseas Koreans staying in the DPRK including delegations and delegates of friendship and solidarity organizations of different countries and international bodies.
					
					 Also present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Kim Jong Suk who is chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with the World People, Choe Jin Su, presidium member of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea, officials concerned and Pyongyangites.
					
					 The co-chairman of the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea, in his speech extended a salute to the heroic Korean people celebrating the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War on behalf of the participants of the march.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk expressed belief that the participants would extend invariable support and solidarity to the Korean people dynamically advancing, holding aloft the banner of Songun, united close around the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The start of the march was declared.
					
					 The participants marched to the tune of the music played by the women's brass band, prompted by the desire to positively support the struggle of the Korean people to foil the U.S. imperialists' moves for isolating and stifling the DPRK and achieve national reunification by concerted efforts.
					
					 People warmly welcomed foreign friends in streets.
					
					 The participants in the march visited Panmunjom that day.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Letter from Participants in Grand International Peace March
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Letter from Participants in Grand International Peace March
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un  Wednesday received a letter from participants in the Grand International Peace March demanding  the conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. and the withdrawal of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and supporting  the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea.
					 The letter said that the great victory won by the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War shattered the myth of the U.S. "mightiness" and recorded a proud page in the history of the struggle of the popular masses for independence. It taught the world the truth that no big power can conquer the people who have absolute trust and love for their leader and country, the letter noted, and continued:
					
					 Instead of drawing a lesson from the Korean War in the 1950s, the U.S. is persistently pursuing the hostile policy toward the DPRK and the moves to ignite a war against it still today when humankind have greeted the new century, though they are denounced by the international community.
					
					 The letter fully supported all measures taken by the DPRK for peace and security in the world and demanded the U.S. conclude a peace treaty with the DPRK and roll back its anachronistic policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The letter expressed belief that peace and security on the Korean Peninsula would be firmly protected and the reunification of Korea be surely achieved as there are the banner of independence, the banner of Songun which Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il consistently held aloft all their lives and the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 We will conduct positive international solidarity activities to support the Korean people in their just cause for building a thriving nation, achieving national reunification and establishing a fair international order, concluded the letter.

articles.title: Construction of Ski Resort on Masik Pass Progresses Apace
articles.content:
Construction of Ski Resort on Masik Pass Progresses Apace
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Signal achievements have been made on a daily basis at the construction site of Ski Resort on Masik Pass with the approach of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The soldier-builders have waged a high-pitched drive to create the "speed on Masik Pass", carrying out 55 percent of the total project and making steady progress.
					
					 A hotel has taken its shape by the devoted efforts of the soldiers.
					
					 Those in charge of the construction of service center, lodgings, underground parking lot, cable operation, heating,  purification and pumping facilities are carrying out their work 1.5 times that of the schedule, two times at the maximum despite difficulties and trials.
					
					 Soldiers have spurred the reservoir project also.
					
					 Defying high altitude and unfavorable transport conditions the builders have given definite precedence to the transport of materials and over-fulfilled the daily assignments for embankment project and concrete tamping.
					
					 Innovations have also been made in the construction of dwelling houses, kindergarten, nursery and power transmission line.
					
					 The pavement of roads extending dozens of kilometers and the construction of bridges, skating ground and swimming pool have made rapid progress together with the arrangement of surrounding areas and the planting of trees and turf of good species.

articles.title: Choe Ki Ryong, First Labor Hero of DPRK
articles.content:
Choe Ki Ryong, First Labor Hero of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea issued a decree on institution of the Title of Labor Hero on July 17, Juche 40 (1951), when the country was in the thick of the Korean War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953).
					 The title went first to Choe Ki Ryong in December that year.
					
					 At that time, Choe made a big contribution to ensuring wartime transport as a locomotive engineer in the Wonsan Locomotive Section.
					
					 One day in July 1950 when he was transporting war supplies by train, he found that another train, loaded with munitions, was trapped in a station yard, set ablaze by air raids. 
					
					 He unhesitatingly ran to the train, put out fire risking his life and shunted the train.
					
					 One day in July 1951, he rescued trains in a station yard from bombing, saving large quantity of munitions.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges Improving North-South Relations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges Improving North-South Relations
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Only when we respect the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and put them into practice, will the way open for saving the inter-Korean relations from stalemate, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The over six decade-long history of national division teaches a serious lesson that the confrontation between the north and the south and the escalation of tension will bring continued division and horrible disaster of a war.
					
					 The DPRK has, therefore, made positive efforts to improve inter-Korean relations with broad magnanimity, though the tension has escalated on the Korean Peninsula owing to the confrontation moves of the south Korean authorities.
					
					 The present south Korean authorities, however, tried to make it appear that they are interested in the improved inter-Korean relations but, in fact, made desperate efforts to escalate the confrontation with compatriots in collusion with outside forces, while paying lip service to "trust".
					
					 Good opportunities for developing the inter-Korean relations have been provided recently. But the north and the south failed to achieve good results due to the anachronistic confrontation policy pursued by the south Korean authorities.
					
					 The north-south declarations serve as programmes for the country's reunification which correctly reflect the desire of the whole nation for the independent reunification and represent all the north-south agreements reached in the past.
					
					 Nothing can replace the north-south declarations in improving the inter-Korean relations and meeting the vital demand and interests of all the compatriots for independent reunification, peace and prosperity.
					
					 It is the will of all the Koreans to turn the inter-Korean relations into those of trust and reconciliation and realize the national unity and the country's reunification.
					
					 The article urges the south Korean authorities to lend an ear to the voices of all the Koreans and opt for the road of national reconciliation, unity and reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspapers Condemn Puppet Regime for Giving Up Military Sovereignty
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspapers Condemn Puppet Regime for Giving Up Military Sovereignty
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- South Korean media denounced the puppet group of traitors for giving up the military sovereignty.
					 The south Korean internet paper Voice of People on July 22 in an editorial quoted the chief executive as saying at the talks with her master U.S. that the "transfer of wartime operation control should be readied in the direction of strengthening the combined defense capacity".
					
					 This, in fact, signals the giving up of the military sovereignty, the editorial said, adding that it hints at the exchange of views for delaying the transfer of the right to command wartime operation at the talks.
					
					 It said matter is the viewpoint of the military authorities and rulers of worshipping and kowtowing to America as they are obsessed to the marrow of their bones with the way of thinking of totally depending on the U.S.
					
					 It demanded the authorities stop the moves for delaying the transfer of the right to command wartime operation that has neither justification nor value.
					
					 Hangyore on July 21 in an editorial said that the voices of derision are being heard even from the inner parts of the U.S., specifying that the authorities sought a political aim to rally the conservative forces with their deep-rooted dependence on the U.S.
					
					 The editorial went on:
					
					 The U.S. acceptance of the demand for the delay will be followed by a huge price.
					
					 Although the issue of the transfer is sparking off a big furor, the chief executive is shunning it.
					
					 If she can not give concrete explanation about the reason for the delay to the people, she has to stop it at once, urged the editorial.

articles.title: More Corruption, Irregularities by Family of Chun Doo Hwan Disclosed
articles.content:
More Corruption, Irregularities by Family of Chun Doo Hwan Disclosed
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- More corruption and irregularities committed by family members of traitor, military dictator and fascist man-killer Chun Doo Hwan have been disclosed, according to the south Korean paper Hangyore on Monday.
					 His wife Lee Sun Ja has deposited a colossal amount of money in secrecy at a bank branch in Taehyon-dong, Seoul since November last year to live a life of luxury with the income from monthly interests amounting to tens of millions of won.
					
					 Chun has refused to accept the demand of people from all social strata to have the property he got through corruption and irregularities during the tenure of his office recollected, claiming that he has just a little property.
					
					 However, the fact went public that his eldest son set up a bogus company abroad and has operated it for six years. The illegal actions of his wife were revealed this time, giving the lie to his claim.

articles.title: WPK's Strategic Line Supported by Peruvian Political Party
articles.content:
WPK's Strategic Line Supported by Peruvian Political Party
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru issued a statement on July 16 in support of the line of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The WPK put forth the line to protect the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation.
					
					 The People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru fully supports the line.
					
					 We pay our respects to the Korean people who are bravely foiling the moves of the U.S. imperialists to dominate the whole Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Just is the struggle of the DPRK to pull the U.S. imperialists out of south Korea.
					
					 The DPRK is stepping up its building of an economic power to provide its people with the best living conditions.
					
					 But the U.S. imperialists are hindering economic construction of the DPRK by waging ceaseless war drills.
					
					 No threat, however, can ever bring the DPRK into submission.
					
					 It is a military power which had access to nuclear deterrence with its indigenous technology.
					
					 It is enjoying full support not only from the Peruvian people but from the progressive humankind.

articles.title: Disbandment of "UN Command" Urged by Egyptian Political Party
articles.content:
Disbandment of "UN Command" Urged by Egyptian Political Party
						
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt released a statement calling for the disbandment of the "UN Command" on July 18.
					 Noting the immediate dismantlement of the command is a touchstone showing the authority and fairness of the United Nations, the statement said:
					
					 The DPRK is a peace-loving country which has positively contributed to protecting peace and security in Asia and other parts of the world as a full-fledged member state of the UN.
					
					 The situation clearly shows the illegality of the command which has abused the name and flag of the UN though it is indifferent to the latter, and the necessity of its dismantlement.
					
					 The Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt calls on the peace-loving people in the world to have a correct understanding of the command and extend support and solidarity to the friendly Korean people in their efforts to protect the country's sovereignty.
					
					 The DPRK has never invaded other country but has protected peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and other parts of the world.
					
					 It is just the U.S. which is falsifying the situation and escalating tension.
					
					 The UN Security Council's provocative "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK is a violation of international law and the height of double-standards.
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people rallied close around the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un will foil the U.S. moves to dominate the whole Korean Peninsula and firmly defend the country's dignity.
					
					 The U.S. and its allies should get their hands off Korea if they do not want to meet death in the flames ignited by them.

articles.title: Cuadros visitan albergue de veteranos de guerra
articles.content:
Cuadros visitan albergue de veteranos de guerra
						
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- Los cuadros del partido y el Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea visitaron este miercoles el albergue de los veteranos de guerra delegados a las festividades del 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Phyong Hae, Kwak Pom Gi, Jo Yon Jun, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin  y los funcionarios del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea se reunieron con los veteranos y les felicitaron.
					
					En pleno acato a la orientacion del partido y el lider, los veteranos realizaron imperecederos meritos al frustrar la invasion armada del imperialismo norteamericano en los combates encarnizados, que decidian el destino del pais, y al defender con honor la libertad y la independencia de la patria.

articles.title: Otorgada orden conmemorativa a ex combatientes antijaponeses, veteranos y benemeritos de guerra
articles.content:
Otorgada orden conmemorativa a ex combatientes antijaponeses, veteranos y benemeritos de guerra
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- Segun el decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea emitido el dia 10, fue otorgada la Orden Conmemorativa del 60o Aniversario del Triunfo en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria a 47 mil 75 ex combatientes antijaponeses, veteranos y hombres benemeritos de guerra, quienes realizaron inmortales meritos en la gran Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria y hicieron gran contribucion en la construccion de la potencia prospera despues de la guerra.
					Convencidos de que Corea triunfara sin falta si cuenta con el Presidente Kim Il Sung, los valientes soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y los habitantes contribuyeron grandemente a la victoria fulminante en la pasada guerra coreana dando pruebas en el frente y la retaguardia de su incomparable heroismo masivo y patriotismo.
					
					Bajo la direccion del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il mediante el Songun, los veteranos y los benemeritos de guerra hicieron gran aporte en el tiempo posbelico tambien a la defensa de la soberania del pais y dignidad nacional y a la aceleracion de la construccion del socialismo frustrando las incesantes acciones del imperialismo norteamericano para repetir la guerra.
					
					El decreto subraya que los condecorados, quienes combatieron derramando sangre por la patria y las generaciones futuras, son tesoros y benefactores del pais y se debe a ellos la prosperidad de hoy.

articles.title: Veteranos delegados rinden tributo a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Veteranos delegados rinden tributo a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
						
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- Los veteranos de guerra delegados a las festividades del 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria visitaron el dia 24 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan.
					Ellos rindieron homenaje ante las estatuas de pie de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il y en los salones de eternidad pensando en que el Mariscal Kim Jong Un continua la historia y tradicion de victorias hechas en el monte Paektu y hace brillar las inmortales hazanas de los lideres antecesores.
					
					Luego pasaron revista a las salas de conservacion de ordenes concedidas a los Generalisimos, las de conservacion de carros, coche electrico, barco y vagones de tren usados por ellos hasta el ultimo periodo de su vida para visitas de orientacion y viajes al extranjero.

articles.title: Tiene lugar acto de juramento de oficiales y soldados del EPC
articles.content:
Tiene lugar acto de juramento de oficiales y soldados del EPC
						
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria tuvo lugar frente a las estatuas de bronce de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il erguidas en el recinto del Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares el acto de juramento de los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea para hacer brillar eternamente las inmortales hazanas de los Generalisimos quienes condujeron a la victoria la confrontacion antiimperialista y antiyanqui y para reunificar a toda costa la patria bajo la direccion del Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Un.
					En la ocasion participaron el jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC Choe Ryong Hae, el jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC Kim Kyok Sik y el ministro de las FAP Jang Jong Nam, los funcionarios de las MINFAP, los oficiales y soldados de las fuerzas terrestres, navales, aereas y antiaereas del EPC y los cadetes de las academias militares y las escuelas revolucionarias a todos niveles.
					
					Choe Ryong Hae, en su informe senalo que la brillante victoria en la pasada guerra coreana fue la de destacada idea militar, originales estrategicas y tacticas y metodos de combate del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung y la de indoblegables fuerzas espirituales manifestadas por el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea unidos firmemente en torno al Presidente.
					
					Subrayo que las hazanas de victoria realizadas por el Generalisimo Kim Il Sung en la guerra brillan del siglo en siglo gracias al Generalisimo Kim Jong Il, general insigne del Songun.
					
					Anadio que la historia y las tradiciones llenas de victorias aseguradas por los Generalisimos se mantienen firmemente por la destacada y sabia direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Enfatizo la necesidad de defender las hazanas de victoria en la guerra y las revolucionarias del Songun de los Generalisimos y glorificar el dia de la victoria, 27 de julio como el de la victoria de la reunificacion de la patria segun la direccion del Comandante Supremo.
					
					El subjefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC No Kwang Chol, el comandante de las fuerzas navales Kim Myong Sik y el comandante de las fuerzas aereas y antiaereas Ri Pyong Chol, en sus discursos juraron traer lo mas pronto posible el dia de la reunificacion con el espiritu de ataque de los soldados heroes de la decada de 1950 y lanzar las salvas de victoria en el cielo de la potencia del monte Paektu.

articles.title: Abierta exposicion de kimilsungias y kimjongilias dedicada al 27 de Julio
articles.content:
Abierta exposicion de kimilsungias y kimjongilias dedicada al 27 de Julio
						
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada aqui la exposicion de kimilsungias y kimjongilias en homenaje al 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					En la sede de exposicion, decorada con esas flores del sol y otras plantas raras, estan colocadas las imagenes sonrientes de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il.
					
					Se exhibieron mas de 20 mil ejemplares de kimilsungia y kimjongilia cultivadas con sumo cuidado por muchas unidades como las instituciones de fuerzas armadas, ministerios y organos centrales, el Presidium del Comite Central de la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon, los compatriotas residentes en ultramar, las representaciones diplomaticas de varios paises y las oficinas de organizaciones internacionales, acreditadas en Corea, las entidades de amistad y solidaridad y personalidades extranjeras.
					
					La ceremonia inaugural se efectuo este miercoles en la Exposicion Permanente de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop y otros funcionarios, los funcionarios de las unidades exponentes, los militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea y los participantes en la presente feria.
					
					Se distinguian ademas el grupo de felicitacion de coreanos residentes en Japon presidido por Hong In Hum, presidente de la comision central de revision de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon), la delegacion de la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en China dirigida por su presidenta Choe Un Bok y otras delegaciones de coreanos radicados en el extranjero, los compatriotas en ultramar y los huespedes extranjeros.
					
					En su discurso de apertura, Kim Chang Do, titular del Comite de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia de Corea, senalo que la presente exhibicion deviene la cita que tiene lugar gracias a la infinita veneracion del ejercito y pueblo coreanos y la humanidad progresista a los grandes hombres del monte Paektu.
					
					Prosiguio que Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia, inmortales flores que llevan nombres del Presidente y el Dirigente, son patrimonio nacional de la Corea del Songun y gran orgullo y gloria para los militares y habitantes coreanos.
					
					Terminado el acto, los participantes pasaron revista a las flores expuestas.

articles.title: Tiene lugar gran marcha internacional por paz
articles.content:
Tiene lugar gran marcha internacional por paz 
						
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar este miercoles desde Pyongyang hasta Kaesong la gran marcha internacional por la paz demandando la concertacion del acuerdo de la paz entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Estados Unidos y la abolicion de la politica hostil anti-RPDC de este imperio y apoyando la reunificacion independiente y pacifica de Corea.
					Antes de iniciar la marcha hubo la ceremonia de partida. 
					
					Tomaron parte en la ocasion los huespedes extranjeros, de visita en Corea, inclusive los miembros de las entidades de amistad y solidaridad de varios paises, las delegaciones y delegados de las organizaciones internacionales, el representante de la sucursal del Frente Democratico Nacional Antiimperialista en Pyongyang y coreanos en ultramar.
					
					Estuvieron presentes tambien Yang Hyong Sop, vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Kim Jong Suk, presidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y titular del comite coreano de solidaridad con los pueblos del mundo, Choe Jin Su, presidente del CC del Frente Democratico para la Reunificacion de la Patria, otros funcionarios interesados y los trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					El copresidente del Comite Regional de Asia-Pacifico de Apoyo a la Reunificacion Pacifica de Corea, en su discurso de la ocasion, dijo que en nombre de los participantes en la gran marcha envia las felicitaciones al heroico pueblo coreano que acoge el 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					
					A su vez, Kim Jong Suk manifesto la conviccion de que los participantes seguiran enviando el invariable apoyo y solidaridad a la lucha del pueblo coreano que unido monoliticamente en torno al Mariscal Kim Jong Un avanza con pasos firmes enarbolando la bandera del Songun.
					
					A continuacion, se declaro el inicio de la gran marcha.
					
					Los participantes marcharon al son de las melodias de la banda de instrumentos de viento de mujeres con la voluntad de respaldar  activamente la lucha del pueblo coreano por lograr la reintegracion territorial con las fuerzas unidas de la nacion frustrando las tentativas de los yanquis tendentes a aplastar la RPDC.
					
					Los trabajadores acudidos a lo largo de la carretera dieron las calurosas felicitaciones a los amigos extranjeros.
					
					El mismo dia, los huespedes extranjeros participantes en la gran marcha recorrieron Phanmunjom.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe carta de participantes en gran marcha internacional por paz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe carta de participantes en gran marcha internacional por paz 
						
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- Los participantes en la gran marcha internacional por la paz en demanda de la concertacion del acuerdo de paz Republica Popular Democratica de Corea-Estados Unidos y la revocacion de la politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y de apoyo a la reunificacion independiente y pacifica de Corea dirigieron el dia 24 una carta al Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					La gran victoria lograda por el pueblo coreano en la pasada guerra coreana rompio el mito de la "supremacia" de EE.UU. y anoto la primera pagina orgullosa en la historia de la lucha antiimperialista y antiyanqui de las masas populares por la independencia asi como demostro a todo el mundo la verdad de que cualesquier potencias no podian doblegar al pueblo que tuvo la absoluta confianza y el amor a su lider y su patria, comienza la carta y continua:
					
					En lugar de sacar la leccion merecida en la guerra coreana de la decada de 1950, EE.UU. recurre hasta hoy en que la humanidad entro en el nuevo siglo a la politica hostil y las maquinaciones de provocacion de guerra contra la RPDC, lo que es objeto de condenacion de la sociedad internacional.
					
					Envia el entero apoyo a todas las medidas que toma la RPDC para la paz y la seguridad del mundo y demanda fuertemente a EE.UU. firmar el convenio de paz con la RPDC y abolir su anacronica politica hostil contra esta.
					
					Expresa conviccion de que gracias a tener la bandera de la independencia, la del Songun mantenida invariablemente por los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il en todas sus vidas y la sabia direccion de Su Excelencia Mariscal Kim Jong Un se defenderan firmemente la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana y se realizara sin falta la reunificacion de Corea.
					
					Subraya que los participantes desplegaran en el futuro tambien las actividades de solidaridad internacional de apoyo a la justa causa del pueblo coreano por la construccion de un Estado prospero, la reunificacion de la patria y el establecimiento de imparcial orden internacional.
